discussion.content: Could this really be correct? Shouldnt "Filter data in the canvas app" be "Power FX"?

comments.content:
depending on the scenario, it might make sense to filter some data before you load it, e.g. if the app is built for only a specific region, maybe it makes sense to filter only the few hundred mb out of hundreds of gigs of data prior loading it to the canvas app. So you need just to load a few hundred MB instead of hundreds of gigs. 

however, the requirement says 'in the canvas app'. therfore, i would go for powerfx.
But the data is supposed to be filtered within the canvas app and not before.

discussion.content:
UPDATE:

https://www.techtarget.com/searchdatamanagement/definition/T-SQL

This page describes well how using T-SQL will assist the filtering of data going into the canvas app from an external SQL database

Copilot
To filter data in the dataflow and in the canvas app, you should use the following tools:

Power Query: Use Power Query to filter and transform the data within the dataflow before it is moved to Microsoft Dataverse. Power Query allows you to apply various transformations and filters to the data, ensuring that only the necessary data is imported.

Power Fx: Use Power Fx within the canvas app to filter the data that users interact with. Power Fx is the formula language for canvas apps and allows you to create dynamic filters and conditions based on user input.

Combining these tools will enable you to efficiently filter data both during the dataflow process and within the canvas app itself.

Filter data in the dataflow: B. Power Query. 
Filter data in the canvas app: A. PowerFx.

Power Query
Power FX

1. Power Query
2. Power Fx

This question mentions filtering data at 2 scenarios:

1) Filtering data from Microsoft SQL server to Dataverse
Use T-SQL (Transact SQL)
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/sql/t-sql/data-types/data-types-transact-sql?view=sql-server-ver16

2) Users filtering data in canvas app
Of course, use Power Fx

2nd answer needs to be Power Fx. You can only use Power Fx formulas within a canvas app.
"You use a dataflow to move some of the data from the database to Microsoft Dataverse. Users will filter the data by using the app."
on exam 08/23

ChatGPT says 

1. Power Query
2. Power Fx

comments.content: Question the ChatGPT again, and it will mention otherwise.

Just mentioning, because ChatGPT does not always provide right answer. But in this case, I think the correct answer for the second condition is Power Fx as the question mentions filtering data in canvas app.

2. Should be Power FX

1 Power query

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

questions.question_text:
You have a canvas app with an embedded Power BI tile.

You share the canvas app. Users report that they are unable to access the Power BI content.

You need to determine why users are unable to access the content.

What is the cause of the user's problems?

choices.B: The Power BI connection is not shared.
choices.A: The Power BI dashboard is not shared.
choices.D: The Power BI interactions property on the Power BI tiles is set to Off.
choices.C: The Power BI Display mode property on the Power BI tiles is set to Disabled.

discussion.content:
Correct! In Exam on 28th January 2023
Scored 781
Correct

I think the answers are correct.
A dataflow is saved as JSON file
A Power BI dataflow should be configured at PowerBI Service

discussion.content:
First one is Entity Extraction because: "The prebuilt entity extraction model recognizes specific data from text that's of interest to your business. The model identifies key elements from text, and then classifies them into predefined categories. "
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/ai-builder/prebuilt-entity-extraction

Second one is clearly Form Processing: "Form processing lets you read and save information from standard documents such as invoices or tax documents."
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/ai-builder/form-processing-model-overview

In exam on 21 July 2021
Not exact but similar. Read AI module. PDF is processed by 'Text Recognition' model.

2- Form Processing

A. Entity extraction
For B, the real term should be "Invoice processing",

There is a note that says : Document processing name used to be form processing until June 2022.
I assume the answer is "form processing" as "Text recognition" is used for other purposes.

The question is asking about AI model type, not pre-built model. There's only five types of AI models: Entity extraction, Form Processing, Object Detection, Category Classification and Prediction.
Therefore, the answer is correct.
Given answers are correct
in exam 10 June 2021

comments.content: "Extracted as a number" means the result is a number (Age), regardless of how it's spelled in text.

discussion.content: In entity extraction, Age is a supported entity. but it is written 'Age of a person, place, or thing, extracted as a number'. But here age is described in text. So I think it should be Key Phrase.

The first time I thought the first question was 'Key phrase', but, reading the documentation, 'Entity Extraction' is better because talking about 'a person's age in a paragraph', and not mentioning that paragraph is in a document. So I think it could refer to a field within an entity.
Age is a supported entity type for the prebuilt entity extraction model. https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/ai-builder/prebuilt-entity-extraction#supported-entity-types
The answer is Entity Extraction and Form Processing. If the invoice was a image then it would be Text Recognition, but Form Processing is the best answer.

comments.content: Correct me if I am wrong, but Form Processing is a Vision based model. Text Recognition would only extract raw text, which we still needs processing.

discussion.content: Category Classification , Entity Extraction, Form Processing and Prediction are the four AI Models. All the others are prebuilt templates available such as business card reader, key phrase extraction, etc. Take a look in the Power Apps Studio/AI Builder, Build option - first screen.

comments.content: I know what one can see in the AI Builder but for some reason Docs disagrees what are the possible AI Models. According to Docs there are 12 different models: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/ai-builder/model-types
"Key Phrase" isn't an AI model and the question is asking which AI model
but it is an AI model https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/learn/modules/get-started-with-ai-builder-key-phrase-extraction/1-intro-key-phrase-extraction

I was thinking about the same initially. After reading this article https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/ai-builder/prebuilt-key-phrase, I think Entity Extraction should be the right answer for the first question.
continuing my post... that identifies a pattern, its automatically finding the "key expressions" in your text. so you cannot choose what you are searching for.

Copilot
Sure, here are the selected solutions for each requirement:

A table of aggregated data must be created in dataflow storage:

Computed Entity: Use a computed entity to perform the necessary calculations and aggregations on the data before storing it in the dataflow storage.
A unique identifier must be created for the table:

Key Column: Create a key column to serve as the unique identifier for the table.
By using a computed entity for aggregation and a key column for unique identification, you can effectively configure your dataflow to meet the specified requirements.

Computed Entity
Key Column
correct

Pls refer to the below link.
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/power-query/dataflows/computed-tables

Computed table is used in a dataflow for aggregated data
A key column is used as an identifier

in two minds about 'merge queries' and 'computed entities' 
merge query: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/power-bi/connect-data/desktop-shape-and-combine-data
computed entity: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/power-query/dataflows/computed-tables
observe the part of the link:
/power-bi/connect-data/
/power-query/dataflows/
merge is to bring columns into one table (example of ms retirement data that has the state name and another table associating state code to state name, finally have state code in the retirement table) and compute is to aggregate the numbers (have two table with service calls associated with accounts and list of accounts) first "in-storage computation" to aggregate the number of sevice calls per year per account and then merge this number to the account list. to finally see a list of accounts with (total) service calls per year.
answers are correct.

ChatGPT: 
To meet the requirements of creating a table of aggregated data and generating a unique identifier, you should use the following options:

Table of Aggregated Data: Fact Table

Explanation: In data warehousing and data modeling, a fact table is typically used to store aggregated numerical measures (facts) that can be analyzed. It is suitable for storing aggregated data.
Unique Identifier: Alternate Key

Explanation: An alternate key is a candidate key that is unique within the entity and can be used as an identifier. It provides an alternative way to uniquely identify records besides the primary key. This would be suitable for creating a unique identifier for your table.
So, the correct options are:

For the table of aggregated data: Fact Table
For the unique identifier: Alternate Key
